page.title: 01Frithville and Sibsey Area
page.content: This ia an area of rich fenland, completely flat, much of it at or below sea-level. Most of the area is used for farming, growing arable crops or market gardening. Most land is a part of very large farms owned by wealthy farmers. Roads are almost completely straight. There are three main roads, the A16 and the B1183 and 1184. The area is drained by a series of drains which are full in summer and nearly empty in winter. There are very few houses, some in Frithville in the N.W and the village of Sibsey in the N.E. Most people in the area work on farms or in drainage or engineering. Others travel to Boston each day. The area has very few facilities. Sibsey is a growing village, with both old hoses and new estates.
